intro: Calystegia sepium var. angulata, commonly known as the angular bindweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, along roadsides, and in waste areas. Due to its vigorous growth, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
